oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uniform group of Pvt. Robert Rufus Rust, Co. K, 117th Inf. Regt., 30th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A uniform group consisting of tunic, breeches and puttees of Pvt. Robert Rufus Rust, Co. K, 117th Inf. Regt., 30th Div. The tunic is the 1917 pattern, with four patch pockets. The left sleeve has a 30th Div. patch at the shoulder, a red discharge stripe on the upper arm and two points down chevrons on the lower forearm. Rust received the U.S. Silver Star and the British Military Medal for his actions in taking out a German machine gun. He worked at the DuPont Plant in Old Hickory after the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World war, 1914-1918; World war, 1914-1918 - History
